alert.note: Alert for Clark; Scotland (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 15 at 8:20PM CDT until June 15 at 9:15PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Van Buren County in southeastern Iowa... Lee County in southeastern Iowa... Northeastern Scotland County in northeastern Missouri... Northwestern Clark County in northeastern Missouri... * Until 915 PM CDT. * At 820 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Cantril, or 9 miles southwest of Keosauqua, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Lake Sugema Campground and Prospect Grove around 830 PM CDT. Mount Sterling and Heath Memorial Conservation Area around 835 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Bonaparte, Chambersburg, Farmington, Indian Lake Park, Anson, Croton, Shimek State Forest, Battle of Athens Campground, Primrose, Donnellson, Lee County Fairgrounds, Argyle, Franklin and Charleston. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building.
